content: the sweet bread shawl is a shallow crescent shape knit in single color brioche with an icord edge knit at the same time as the body the bind off is a simple stretchy one and the pattern after the setup row is just a one row repeat yay you may choose any yarn/needle combination that you like for my sample i used a fingering weight sock yarn and 3 75 mm needles have fun stash diving or use this as an excuse to go to your fave local yarn shop to splurge on that silk-merino-cashmere-unicorn blend you ve been wanting i would recommend getting at least 200 grams of yarn if not more as brioche is a yarn eater i would recommend making a swatch or just knitting the first 10 or so row of the pattern just to see if you like the fabric you are getting i know that some of us hate swatching but you ll want to get the smooshy-gooshy-squishy fabric of brioche just right right worst case you ll have to rip out a few row but best case is you ll be on your way results may vary depending on the fiber so just keep that in mind when you go to block your piece also you are gonna need -blocking supplies -scissors -tapestry needle have fun i d love to see your projects since this is a free pattern all i ask is that you use your pattern money to support your favorite charity if you are able
